listing:
  contents: posts
  sort: date desc
  type: grid
  sort-ui: false
  filter-ui: false


### Explanation:

1. **YAML Front Matter**:
   - `title`: Sets the title of the page.
   - `page-layout`: Sets the page layout to full width.
   - `title-block-banner`: Enables the title block banner.

2. **Markdown Content**:
   - **Projects Section**:
     - `# Projects`: Adds a header for the Projects section.
     - ```{r}``` block: Contains a `listing` directive to list the contents of the `projects` folder, sorted by date in descending order and displayed in a grid format without sort and filter UI.
   
   - **Posts Section**:
     - `# Posts`: Adds a header for the Posts section.
     - ```{r}``` block: Contains a `listing` directive to list the contents of the `posts` folder, sorted by date in descending order and displayed in a grid format without sort and filter UI.

### How to Use:
1. Save the above content into a file named `new.qmd`.
2. Ensure the file is placed in the root or appropriate directory of your Quarto project.
3. Update your `_quarto.yml` file to include a link to `new.qmd` in the navbar if needed.

### Example Update to `_quarto.yml` (if required):
```yaml
project:
  type: website

website:
  title: "Jason Saito's Website"
  navbar:
    right:
      - text: Projects & Blog Posts
        href: new.qmd
      - text: Interests
        menu:
          - text: LLMs Blog
            href: blog.qmd  
          - text: Project 2
            href: blog.qmd  
          - text: Project 3
            href: blog.qmd
      - icon: github
        href: https://github.com/jason-saito
      - icon: linkedin
        href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jason-saito/
      - icon: gmail
        href: mailto:jsaito@sas.upenn.edu
format:
  html:
    theme: morph
    css: styles.css

execute:
  freeze: auto
